intro: Canthium nitens, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and diverse morphological features. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with simple, opposite leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cyathium structures, a defining trait of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium nitens is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
